skillTree.localised_description: A horse! A horse! An acceptable amount of florins for a horse!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Battle protects Her own.
Costly gear lent to the mercenary companies may be expensive, but it may save the day and the treasury afterwards.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
This man has not gotten where he is now by being weak-minded.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The doubt that betrayal would hardly bring woes but even monetary incentives has turned the tables of many battles.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Myrmidia, if not a member outright. Myrmidia is an ascended mortal and the chief deity in the south, and the vast influence of her cults teach tactical acumen, mercy, and civilization.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Nahmud, if not a member outright. Although part of the vaster Myrmidian cults, the various sects of Nahmud favour equality and special education, and are somewhat too fond of secrecy.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Sister Fury, if not a member outright. One of Myrmidia's companions in life, Fury's legacy is one of intense, violent, but controlled rage and violence against injustice and destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Solkan, if not a member outright. The merciless god is one of the most ancient, and just as timeless is his unbridled retribution against the corrupted. His is currently a relatively awkward presence, strongest in Remas.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Morr, if not a member outright. The old god of the dead's legacy is one of fatalism and certainty, and finds its largest seat in Luccini.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Shallya, if not a member outright. Her teachings of healing and compassion feel at odds with the world's grimness and darkness, which is also why many flock to her.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Verena, if not a member outright. Like her husband Morr, the blind deity's legacy is not only one of learning and justice, but also one of detached impartiality.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Ranald, if not a member outright. He is one of many and sometimes darker aspects, but the lord of fortune was also the only one who could make Morr smile. Somewhat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the lousiest commander knows that you need two halves of a pair of scissors.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +3 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +6% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mercenary hosts usually include powerful regiments with double pay and double the risks, once dubbed in Tilea "Duplicarii". The original meaning has gone lost, and the usual sense is now "You bunch of dog-botherers will better get it done, with what you cost me."

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
This unit's vigour is less affected by fatiguing actions, such as combat.

skillTree.localised_description: Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)
effects.icon: BUGGED FOR XP UNIT SETS, HAPPENS BY DEFAULT, INTENDED

skillTree.localised_description: Being known for actually paying one's hirelings - those that come back alive, anyway - pays off.
Personally seizing the means of production never felt better.
Improving infrastructure and rebuilding the war-ravaged regions is key to a prosperous economy.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -7% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Money must flow.
"I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

effects.description:
Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +8% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: A commander that allows his captains and troops to everything they can put their hands on is either irresponsible, well-adviced, criminally aggressive or all of the above.
"People say that the colour of magic is purple, white, red... I say it is gold. For all that lot."

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +5% for Wizards
	(local province)

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +10% for Wizards
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: This man can easily distinguish between an ancient elven magical sword of implacable might and a piece of shiny iron, which is not so simple when the artifact itself is in that disguise.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes it is just time to party. The louder, the better.
This commander has accrued a retinue of the sliest and shrewdest captains and guides available. Their advice is worth every silver coin.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: War is merely the extension of economy by other means. But you do need someone to do the actual killing.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Mercenary Captains
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
Being supportive of the flourishing tilean art is prestigious, and prestige is lucrative.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
"You know you're doing it right when everyone and their mamas are sending people to stab you."

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: Knowledge that the enemy wallet might buy your troops out even before the first battle puts huge pressure to make sure it doesn't happen.
Commerce is the life-blood of any economy, and the sea must be its heart.

"Open the coffers, put up more signs. I want more cannons, pikes, even ogres, even those buggers with the paper wings. Everyone. I shall have that castle by tomorrow or by Myrmidia I will drown them in mercs."
Kill not, waste not.
Such is the pinnacle of the tilean merchant prince and politician that seemingly anything can be handled.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
"If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away."
"The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.

nodes.localised_description: A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.

effects.description:
All damage: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)
